body: This will either need an upgrade rule, or we'll want to keep the default (no prefix) to HSL.
It still parses the prefix-less format for `HSLColor` (and `Color`). The `hsl,` prefixes were added so that modders would see that the colors are in the HSL color space.

Currently, this allows for a gradual transition by saving in the new format and writing in the new format once documentation is added. Another approach would be to change everything and use an upgrade rule as mentioned.

Fortunately #8659 added support for that not too long ago, so an upgrade rule might be the better option. This does break map compatibility unless they get upgraded, but I don't think that is that much of an issue.

OK, I'll add upgrade rules unless someone objects.

That said, should prefix-less values still be supported then?
Can you pull out utility methods for parsing a `Color` or `HSLColor` from a string?  This will reduce a bit of duplication and make `FieldLoader` much cleaner.

Changed:
- Common color loading and upgrade rule methods
- `name` color space added because it requires little additional code and they are easier to read which will be helpful as more colors are un-hardcoded.

Still not sure about including default color spaces for when the color space prefix is absent.
Needs a rebase.
IMO we whouldn't allow for the "identifier is missing" case. That would just make it harder to read. And to upgrade in the future.
Rebased.
Rebased again.
Needs a rebase again...
Rebased.
Needs a rebase again.
Rebased yet  again. Hopefully, nothing conflicts for a while. I was hoping `git` would not have trouble with this and #9444.

Spotted no issues and in-game all mods looked normal.
:+1:
Sorry, needs rebasing again.
Seems like one of the new maps needs to be updated.
I noticed and already fixed, hopefully.
I forgot to run `make test` _after_ the default color spaces were removed.

I haven't been that much of a fan of the mandatory prefixes, but haven't had time to think about alternatives until now.  I think a better approach would be to use html style colour codes (e.g. CC0000 for dark red) for rgb, and then keep the current 3-part syntax for hsl.  That leaves no ambiguity in parsing the definitions.
Changed to hex color parsing.

I won't block a merge over this if the majority favors this approach, but personally I'd say from a modders perspective, the prefix was still _far_ more user-friendly than html could ever be. Every modder understands what 255,120,44 means in rgb, but with html, many (most?) would have to use a dec-hex converter, bye-bye to getting the desired color quickly and without much thinking.

Since I have written both ways already, I could do either. The prefix system could gain the advantages of the HTML color system by adding a `hex` prefix and replacing `,` with spaces (helpful with parsing Color[]).

Another option would be to add the space splitting and parse `(hhhhhh(hh | ',' a)? | r ',' g ',' b ',' [a])`:

```
hhhhhh    - 1 part, length of 6
hhhhhhhh  - 1 part, length of 8
hhhhhh, a  - 2 parts
r, g, b     - 3 parts
r, g, b, a   - 4 parts
```
- The format is unique to the number of parts with the exception of `hhhhhh[hh]` which is unique by length.
- use a number (1-4) prefix counting the number of components per `Color` comma delimited lists for `Color[]` loading.
- Hex color pickers could be used allowing for closure of #8984.
- Deprecates normalized HSL color space, which is considered confusing by many.
- Modders don't need to adapt to hex values.

Opinions?

r,g,b[,a] triples (quads) might be a bit easier for modders (personally, I find the other way - I can quite happily visualize hex color codes, but need to concentrate or look up anything except crude r,g,b triples) but makes it significantly more complicated on our end because of the ambiguity of alpha/non-alpha in arrays, and with h,s,l colors.  Going with hex codes is a simple solution to something that shouldn't need to be complicated.

@reaperrr:
What about adding a rgb[a] to to conversion to `OpenRA.Utility.exe`?

Adding something like:

```
$ [mono] OpenRA.Utility.exe all --rgba2hex 255,255,255 96,96,96,128
FFFFFF, 60606080
```

That would help I guess.

Generally speaking, I know I'd be able to adapt to it, but I wanted to point out that some modders might complain.

Anyway, needs rebase.
No activity since a while, please reopen this when you come back to it.
Reopening as discussed on IRC.
